name: large-file-warning
description: Warns about committing large files that should use Git LFS
prompt:
Before git add or git commit, check for large files:

**Size Thresholds:**
- Warning: Files > 10MB
- Block: Files > 100MB

**If Large File Detected:**

```
⚠️  LARGE FILE WARNING

File: [filename]
Size: [size] MB

Issues with large files in git:
• Slows down clone/pull operations
• Increases repo size permanently
• GitHub has 100MB file limit
• Poor performance for team

Recommended solutions:

1. Use Git LFS (Large File Storage):
   git lfs install
   git lfs track "*.psd"
   git lfs track "*.mp4"
   git add .gitattributes

2. Store externally:
   - Cloud storage (S3, GCS, Azure Blob)
   - CDN for static assets
   - Artifact repository

3. Alternative approaches:
   - Link to external location in README
   - Use download script
   - Store in release assets

Large file types to use LFS for:
• Images: *.psd, *.ai, *.sketch
• Videos: *.mp4, *.mov, *.avi
• Archives: *.zip, *.tar.gz, *.7z
• Binaries: *.exe, *.dll, *.so
• Data files: *.csv, *.parquet (large ones)

Proceed with commit? (yes/no)
```
